dashboard.readout

Class LevelReadout.Builder<T extends LevelReadout.Builder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dashboard.readout.Readout.Builder<T>
      • dashboard.readout.LevelReadout.Builder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - dummy parameter to enable the subclasses to return their exact type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarReadout.Builder, DialReadout.Builder
    Enclosing class:
    LevelReadout

    public abstract static class LevelReadout.Builder<T extends LevelReadout.Builder>
extends Readout.Builder<T>
    Builder for the LevelReadout class, to be extended by all subclasses of LevelReadout.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(double width,
               double height,
               int numDivisions)
        Creates a Builder specifying a LevelReadout with the given dimensions and number of divisions. If the number of divisions is set to 0, the LevelReadout will operate in continuous mode, calculating the number of divisions based on the size of the LevelReadout itself. This allows each level to roughly correspond to a layer of pixels.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the LevelReadout
        height - the height of the LevelReadout
        numDivisions - the total number of levels into which the LevelReadout should be divided
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of divisions is negative

    • Method Detail

      • withRange

        public T withRange(double minValue,
                   double maxValue)
        Specifies the minimum and maximum values of the LevelReadout.
        Parameters:
        minValue - the real value to which the lowest level corresponds
        maxValue - the real value to which the highest level corresponds
        Returns:
        the current Builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum value is not greater than the minimum value
